comment._content: i think victoran47 you are missing the point... the photogs aren't interested in having their photos critiqued... since they are long dead... this is what their war looked like...

comment.author: 61931273@N00
comment._content:
This is what war looks like laying in the grass looking over your rifle, waiting for the clear to advance.

Its honestly an amazing shot, iam sure for those what might remember it looks exactly like it.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: —Photo caption from AWM: "Canadians advance south of the railway. Canadian skirmishers with a tank of the 13th Tank Battalion attacking a machine gun post, which was on the north side of the railway hedge, in front of the Australian sector of the line. Some difficulty was experienced in obtaining this photograph as the men were at the time under heavy fire from machine guns from the trees on the skyline in the distance on the right. Seen in the centre, Lieutenant (Lt) Hall and Lt Payne routing out an enemy machine gun post. "Taken August 10, 1918, at Picardie, Somme, Lihons, France."
